sentences.sContent: We went out in spite of the rain.
sentences.sCn: 尽管下着雨，我们还是出去了。

sentences.sContent: Kelly loved her husband in spite of the fact that he drank too much.
sentences.sCn: 虽然丈夫酗酒，凯莉仍然爱着他。

sentences.sContent: She broke it just out of spite.
sentences.sCn: 她就是出于恶意把它打破的。

sentences.sContent: The neighbours throw things over the garden wall just to spite us.
sentences.sCn: 邻居把东西扔过花园围墙，故意和我们作对。

sentences.sContent: ...In spite of her busy social life...
...In spite ofall of her experience in Washington...
...In spite of the awful inconveniences caused by racial prejudice...

exam.question: He always did well at school _______ having to do part-time jobs every now and then.

answer.explain: 尽管。句意： 尽管偶尔不得不去做兼职， 但他在学校的成绩一直很好。 regardless of： 不管， 不论； on account of： 因为； in case of： 假设， 万一。

remMethod.val: spi (看作spy， 间谍) ＋ te → 人们普遍对间谍怀有怨恨 → 恶意， 怨恨

trans.tranOther: without being affected or prevented by something
to deliberately annoy or upset someone
